title: Had so much fun losing!

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
This game went over 60 minutes, it was a super heated back and forth, and honestly when they finally won it was due to team mates getting caught out, but I didn't even care.  Super fun game.  I would love to play against anyone on that enemy team again.

Special honor to Elite Four Jeff especially, very honorable player, and the enemy team MVP.  They were pretty much beaten, but he carried them back into the game after Vi and Teemo got caught in several 2v1 or 3v1 plays.  I wish I had a replay of this game, because it was just a stellar game.

replies.body: I actually like those protracted, epic games. Also props on the positivity!
replay sysytem pls
{{summoner:11}}
This wouldn't happen to be you, right?
Indeed it would not! We report the problems, so more often it's, "Hey, something isn't working correctly!"
May I ask what a "Noc Technician" is?  Also do you know what the favorite champion of the person in charge of the Riot Support twitter account is?  And if they like poros?

Rock "The Rock" Rockburgh (favorite movie: The Rock, favorite wrestler: The Rock, favorite pet: a rock) got it right, "Network Operations Center."

We monitor for problems and escalate on them when we find them. ***/ducks***

I imagine multiple people man that account, and I think everyone likes poros! (Right?)

Darn I wanted to draw them a horrible sketch since I'm a (terrible) artist once I find a pencil.  Haven't drawn in a while though.  Anyway, I wanted to tailor it to what they like, but it seems anything will do.  What do you mean by escalate on the problems?  Either way thanks for letting us back into the game the other day, assuming you helped.

Post it here, and I can send it over to the group.

We don't do the fixing, we just notify the right people so they can fix it (escalating). I actually was the one who first spotted the problem you are referring to, but I certainly didn't fix it myself!
Nice job, dude!  Also I was already going to post it on Twitter, they're expecting me maybe (once I find a good pencil.)

I have a question. Could you check out some of the threads offering ideas about champion select. I especially liked one that called for a team vote deciding whether or not to dodge a game if there is a toxic player. http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/07bZpEaN-should-be-an-option-to-abort-a-game-in-champ-select-with-at-least-4-votes-on-one-team
Network Operations Center, I believe.
he is a nocturne main

> [{quoted}](name=Bark Wahlberg,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=xK6t03h7,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2014-12-22T16:35:41.143+0000)
>
> I actually like those protracted, epic games. Also props on the positivity!

me to  the ones that   go over an hour seem like the most fun  I love it when a game last long enough to get my "epic full build" lol

Oh man, I was in a game as Janna support, and we were an hour in with my team mostly feeding, but i carried us by engaging and peeling so hard my teammates simply couldn't lose fights. It felt epic, and I got 9x honored. :D

> [{quoted}](name=Bark Wahlberg,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=xK6t03h7,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2014-12-22T16:35:41.143+0000)
>
> I actually like those protracted, epic games. Also props on the positivity!

I agree.  Long back-and-forth games are so much more fun than 20 minute stomps for both teams.  I think the sweet spot is around 40-50 minutes as long as it isn't too one-sided.  I love it when a round looks over and then the farmed Nasus (or other lategame champ) on the losing team shows up and turns things around.  

By the way, on a related topic, 20-25 second teamfights are a lot more fun than 4-6 second teamfights... Not sure if you have anything to do with game balance, so Just sayin'.
Nah! Best teamfights are 3 minute teamfights where both teams go in one at a time. Stupidity on both sides. You just have to slap your head and laugh.

Dat Time
Dat Farm
Dat Gold
Dem wards
Dat 2.2k crit...
Both teams had 4 dragons, while yours had the 5th stack twice!

I don't even...

/slow clap

That looks like a fun game. Looks like everyone bought several Elixers too.
Wish I coulda been there. Props to you for being so positive about the loss!

Also, as someone who gets stuck support a lot, I want to give you props on those wards. 62? Holy crap. I get that the game went on a while, but you had more wards then their top 2 combined!

Thanks for all the warm comments guys!  I think the difference in wards is purely due to their team having a  Teemo, he had our jungle shroomed to hades, so they didn't need vision on our side so less warding.

That Vi never warded...... Wow.

P.S. I like the True Damage part. I like how Blitzcrank was the only one that didn't do any sort of True Damage, not even 100 points like you did. lol. That 28K true damage dealt to minions by Volibear though.

I clicked into this thread expecting yet another sarcastic whine about a loss, which is what I expect by default for all the threads I've read on this forum. But props for you being positive. League needs more people like you :)
I agree with this post. It does not matter if you win or lose. With that type of game it is just a blase to play.

54367

The most fun game I had last season was a loss.  I queue'd up a TB game but all the slots were for bot support.  I don't know if you realize this but the coolest/nicest/team-players are supports AND they are usually the best players in the game.  

We all played AMAZING and it was a close game all through out.  The enemy team were 100% trying as hard as they could to win to avoid the insult of being beaten by supports while we were laughing our asses off having fun and working together.  

Fun game and we Barely lost.. Barely but it was so fun we were happy anyway and I got 2 new Awesome people for my FL.  It's to bad riot likes trolls more than positive people.  This game could be soooo much more fun sooo much more often.  Instead I think riot likes to think of itself as Ramsey Bolton and it's players like Reek.

That sounds like a lot of fun! I used to play with a buddy and we would have 5 midlaners! Somebody like tf would bait and we'd get an early kill mid and then spread out and everybody ganked everyone's lanes and roamed together. Always fun, win or lose!

I love those long epic games.

PS - you've got a little bit over 40% cdr in that build :)

> [{quoted}](name=Irony Man99,realm=NA,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=xK6t03h7,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2014-12-22T20:51:40.399+0000)
>
> I love those long epic games.
> 
> PS - you've got a little bit over 40% cdr in that build :)

What's truly sad about that fact: I changed my build three times in that game... didn't even realize I durp'd that lol.
He had a scanner, not sure if he sold it, or its a glitch.
The player builds will tell you. lol. He sold it at 59 minutes. That spam of Iron Elixer every minute though. lol
Not to be that guy who points thing out but... Voli no trinket? Was that the whole game?
He sold his sweeper at 59 minutes if you look at the player builds section.
At first I thought it was sarcasm...

honestly, as frustrating as really drawn out matches can be, they're my favorite, so long as both teams are neck and neck.

"oh you caught me out? no biggie, im getting you next time for sure" and then boom, outplayed.
both teams struggling for dragon, first blood doesnt come in for about 10 minutes in, everyone getting kills and assists, clutch plays, no one is messing up too severely, etc etc.
i dont mind the trash talk from either team sometimes, if its a game like that. usually its funny, and not blatantly outright mean.

and if we lose? its a sincere gg, and would love playing that over again. everyone gets honors, the post game is filled with jokes, and people offering tips. thats what i play league for.

glad you had fun losing, lol :P
I love that feeling when a game is so balanced until finally one team manages to tip the scales in their favour and win.

I really love games like that, especially if it's a friendly environment so either team congratulates the winning team and aren't bitter about losing, don't complain about their team etc. It's rare but it's awesome

I really like really long normal games because everybody just eventually stops playing seriously at 40 min and we have a ton of fun.

But few days ago i lost a 1 hour ranked win to server error and i was super pissed off..... i would have been in Silver 1 if i won too (yeah i suck)

I've had about 5 games like this since I started playing in 4-5 years. It's those highs that make this game great and keep me coming back. The game goes so well for both teams, but eventually, someone gets to make a play and its over. Those games that could have gone either way. Not mad at them at all, you just wish more games went like that and just weren't decided in the first 10 minutes...
lol for a second i thought this was gonna be a leaverbuster complaint thread.
*cringe*
how tf did volibear deal so much true damage?

Ranger's Trailblazer, I'd guess. Since it causes Smite to deal extra damage to minions and monsters surrounding the target, I'd imagine that over the course of ~50 minutes (from 6:27 to 55:57) that would add up to a *lot* of extra True Damage.
double IE Lucian lmao
I don't like getting 4 shotted by an ADC but I guess people enjoy different things about moba's ;p
Dont buy {{item:3504}}
